Posts.Content: No MAMMO!!! Your are pregnant and each mammo increase breast cancer risk by 2%. Insist on ultra sound, it will tell if cyst or mass.
Posts.Title: Please help me

Posts.Content: Wow!! They should tell you that. That's horrible. I made a big mistake allowing them to remove the nodes as I never intended to agree to chemor radiation.
Posts.Title: Pain underarm from sentinal node removal-How Long???

Posts.Content: I have a lumpectomy and 3 sentinal nodes removed April 6th. My underarm is till killing me. My breast is also still very sore and I am wondering just how long to expect this pain. I usually heal very quickly and this is disturbing to me. They make it sound like its nothing but if I had to do it over, I would have refused the node removal, for many reasons.
Posts.Title: Pain underarm from sentinal node removal-How Long???

Posts.Content: Get a whoile body Thermography scan. You will have to pay for it but its well worth it., See what the tech says about it being in the other breast. There is no guarantee the other breast is involved., What where the margins form the lumpoectomy and what was going on with the nodes??
Posts.Title: femara long term effects

Posts.Content: Don't EVER do another mammo. Each mammo increases breast cancer risk by 2% and is cumulative. So 10 mammos =20% higher risk. Insist on Ultra sound or MRI only!!!!
Posts.Title: How soon to have first mamogram done after ending raadiation treatments ?

Posts.Content: Your onxo test was based on the tumor genonomics NOT your blood work on Femara. 17% is VERY low. I would start to tery other modalities, such as the Gerson Therapy or the Budwig Protocol. You are killing yourself with these toxic drugs.
Posts.Title: femara long term effects

Posts.Content: Some of it looks interesting, some not so much....
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with Breast Cancer.

Posts.Content: Are you having masectomy or lumpectomy. What size is the tumor?
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with Breast Cancer.

Posts.Content: Hi Lesley, I am 60 and was diagnosed end of March. They can tell from the Ultra sound the approx size of the tumor. Mine was .8 cm. I opted for Limpectomy and sentinal node removal, which was done. My margins and nodes where clear so they staged me at 1A. They automatically send you to Radiologist. Depending on the stage of the tumor and at our age, little may be gained from radiation and a lot may be lost. Wait to get all reports. Ask for the OnxoDX testing, not that it means all that much, but it gives you a rate of recurrance. I have decided not to do any toxic treatments and am doing healthy modalities. Try to get your hands on Ty Bollingers "Quest for the Cure". It can be watched on You Tube and look into the Gerson Therapy. I have never felt better since I started to follow it, right after the surgery.
Posts.Title: Newly Diagnosed with Breast Cancer.

Posts.Content: You don't. You get another doctor. If yours is andry or threatened that you consulted someone else, they have to go. They are not looking out for your best interest. They should encourage 2nd opinions.
Posts.Title: How to make my doctor consider other options ?!

Posts.Content: Thanks for the input. I'm not depending on the Gerson to cure the cancer, just to help build my immune system. I don't think anything cures cancer. Once struck, we are stuck. I just want the best quality of life, as long as that may be. Today I found out that the rrot canal I do is on the tooth that is related to my left breast, which was the cancer site. I really feel there is a direct correlation to the cancer and that tooth. I will have it removed. There are modalities that can help us that are not as toxic.
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx testing and decisions made

Posts.Content: The # on the Onco is based on the patient taking Tamoxifin only. For the intermediate group, if your docetr is honest, they have no answers which way to send you.
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx testing and decisions made

Posts.Content: I have a score of 26 also. I am unwilling to radiate or poison myself, on the fence about anti estrogens. Will speak to my blood specialist next week,. She doesn't believe in ANY of the traditional therapys and the statistics really don't lie. They really do NOT help. Doing the gerson therapy and have never felt better. It's hard but it can't hurt as all typical modalities do and the risk to benefit ratio is just too low to subject myself to them.
